page.title: 07Communications & Transport
page.content: Most people in the area have their own cars. Buses run three or four times a day to Leamington and Kineton. In Chadshunt there is one public telephone box and one post box. Most houses have private phones. Public footpaths are seldom used, poorly signposted and have been ignored by farmers. Since there is little to keep people in the area by way of employment and recreation, most people commute heavily. The main centres that people look towards are Kineton (a small town) and Leamington, where they will travel for shops, work, entertainment.
